content:
Hey folks! We're releasing 1.15.1 (and 1.14.3) today to update CKEditor to the latest version. It's a security release but as it's a hardening in a 3rd party library which has been released publicly both for CKEditor and Drupal, we can coordinate it publicly. https://twitter.com/backdropcms/status/1240477240804032513

There will be a #BackdropCMS security release next Wednesday March 25th. It will include an update to CKEditor version 4.14.

- Backdrop CMS (@backdropcms)

PR for 1.x: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/3103
PR for 1.14.x: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/3104

List of things to confirm as working in CKEditor: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3355 (see summary)

Update CKEditor to version 4.14.0. by quicksketch · Pull Request #3103 · backdrop/backdrop
Fixes backdrop-ops/security#87.
Update CKEditor to version 4.14.0. by quicksketch · Pull Request #3104 · backdrop/backdrop
Fixes backdrop-ops/security#87 for 1.14.x. The commit from #3103 applies cleanly to both 1.x and 1.14.x. This separate PR is being created so we can get a separate sandbox to test.
Keep CKEditor and plugins up to date. · Issue #3355 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
This is a sibling to #2493 Keeping the editor up to date regularly should minimise troubleshooting issues introduced along the way (because we'll be "jumping" less versions up). List ...

@Nate Lampton squeeze #4330 in? (one-liner simple fix)

Users with the "Administer themes" permission cannot change colors · Issue #4330 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Steps To Reproduce To reproduce the behavior: On a vanilla installation, create a new user, and assign them the "Editor" role. Grand the "Administer themes" permission to the &q...

I'm checking the Drupal 8 queue to see if they are having any of these problems: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/3103

Update CKEditor to version 4.14.0. by quicksketch · Pull Request #3103 · backdrop/backdrop
Fixes backdrop-ops/security#87.
Thanks! It has been merged. I'm a little out of practice and accidentally cherry-picked the commit into 1.14.x. So 1.15.1 and 1.14.3 will both have that fix now @klonos ^^
All good @Nate Lampton ...it's just an "innocent" one-liner that fixes a mis-typed permission name. Should be good :+1:
...sorry for not being around guys. Work is crazy + I am having what seem mild symptoms (but could be wrong and just be fatigue and/or jet-lag). ...I am working in small bursts.
@klonos lots of people are also confusing anxiety for shortness of breath.
Fingers crossed that's all it is!!!
I am having dry cough that comes and goes + headaches (no fever yet though)
ohnoes, drink lots of fluids!
plus vitamins and chicken noodle soup and anything else anyone says works :)
lots of sleep!
@klonos - I would like to temper @jenlamptons suggestion "anything else anyone says works" and advice against blowing a hair dryer up your nose. A city councilor in Florida was recommending that.
lol omg really?

Quoting my best friend from back when we were 17-18yo:

I'm not afraid of 1 or 2 or 3 stupid people ...they start scaring me when they come in groups.
...group stupidity seems to be becoming a thing with this COVID-19 crisis
there's a failing test @Nate Lampton
Looks like ZenCI just failed to run at all, rather than it being a specific fail. I'll close/reopen and let them rerun.
@Nate Lampton what can I do to be helpful?

Well, the only test failing is the good old FAIL: Start and end date on same day with timezone, with remaining days is rendered correctly. :frowning: That's the test @klonos had tried to get fixed a few months ago. I think we should proceed with this being RTBC. That failure is intermittent and completely unrelated to updating CKEditor.
sounds good to me
Not that timezone thing again:disappointed:
yeah.

I'm actually seeing the test failure locally, which is a first for me. Unfortunately the follow-up fix at https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4248 does not fix my local test failures either. Ah well. That's for another time. Let's get 1.15.1 out.

Date: Do not show remaining days if event is on same day, and time has elapsed · Issue #4248 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
The following was reported in #4180 by @indigoxela: I concentrated on testing your changes in date.theme.inc. Your PR has one glitch, that doesn't appear without the patch: If a date is on the ...
Okay, that issue is merged. I'll start tagging the releases.

@jenlampton https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.14.4 is up.

backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop core code repository. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop development by creating an account on GitHub.

And now https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.15.1 is up as well.

backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop core code repository. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop development by creating an account on GitHub.
nice :) I'll work on release notes :)

Can someone review https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4346?

Backdrop 1.14.4 Release checklist · Issue #4346 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Release scheduled for March 25th, 2020 3pm - 6pm PT Pre-release tasks Merge commits @quicksketch Draft Release notes @jenlampton Short, descriptive summary of the release, for example: Maintenance ...

@jenlampton Issue #4330: Check config archives contain allowable files before import. is the wrong issue description. It should be Issue #4330: Users with the "Administer themes" permission cannot change colors.
Issue number is correct, just the description doesn't match.
ty

better? https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4346

Backdrop 1.14.4 Release checklist · Issue #4346 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Release scheduled for March 25th, 2020 3pm - 6pm PT Pre-release tasks Merge commits @quicksketch Draft Release notes @jenlampton Short, descriptive summary of the release, for example: Maintenance ...
@quicksketch how many commits are in 1.15.1?

I have https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4347 and am still counting, are there a ton?

Backdrop 1.15.1 Release checklist · Issue #4347 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Release scheduled for March 25th, 2019 8pm - 9pm PT Pre-release tasks Merge commits @quicksketch Create the next bugfix milestone @jenlampton Move all unfinished issues to the next bugfix release m...

Looks like 11.

Issue #3355: Update CKEditor to version 4.14.0.
Issue #3853: Parameter 3 to views_ui_build_form_state() expected to be a reference, value given in views_ui_ajax_form().
Issue #4328: viewsSearchQuery class missing from autoloader.
Issue #4330: Fixed the permission check in the color module so that users other than UID 1 can see the color preview.
Issue #4321: Fix language pseudo field's weight to allow re-ordering.
Issue #4326: Fix small typo in Basis theme's README.md.
Issue #4299: Fix taxonomy_get_term_by_name() docblock.
Issue #4034: Remove redundant 'contentinfo' aria role from 'footer'.
Issue #4225: Fix permission checking for individual vocabularies.
Issue #4280: Fix "chronological" spelling.
Issue #4288: Fix typo in taxonomy_vocabulary_load_multiple() docblock.
good, that's what drush rn got :)

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4347

Backdrop 1.15.1 Release checklist · Issue #4347 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Release scheduled for March 25th, 2019 8pm - 9pm PT Pre-release tasks Merge commits @quicksketch Create the next bugfix milestone @jenlampton Move all unfinished issues to the next bugfix release m...
Looks good.
great, gong to cut both releases.
Published https://backdropcms.org/node/2797
well, it wont save that node.
it's been saving for like 2 minutes!
is the site up?
uhoh "SQLSTATE[HY000]: General error: 1205 Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction"
@Nate Lampton any ideas what that is?
@Nate Lampton just got that error twice :/
Huh, that's weird! Site is still up, I see that node still unpublished
bah :(
trying VBO approach
other nodes seem to save ok
I'll just create a new SA.
Weird, that one node's UPDATE query is stuck in MySQL.
@jenlampton looks like it finally saved. Try again?
nopw: https://backdropcms.org/security/backdrop-sa-core-2020-001
now the new one wont save either :(
and the old one won't delete?
I restarted MySQL. Now things seems to be saving properly.
nope
this one saved: https://backdropcms.org/node/2803/edit but won't edit :/
stuck again
wont save after editing
oh, no this is worse: 504 Gateway Time-out
now getting this again: SQLSTATE[HY000]: General error: 1205 Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction
@Nate Lampton Justin can look into this at 9pm. we can do a manual sql query to publish the node
leave the rest for him?
MySQL--
@jenlampton Try making a new node with all the same content. Even running the query directly doesn't work, but only for that one node.
This is a duplicate node that also won't save: https://backdropcms.org/node/2803/edit
This was the original node that would not save: https://backdropcms.org/node/2797/edit
image.png
weird

@Nate Lampton we can leave this for justin to fix. We know we can save a new node once, why don't we create a 3rd duplicate, and this time I'll be careful to set the status to published the first time.
Sure, go for it. So weird.
ok, can you restart mysql?
I can do it if you are already logged out
trying...

Sometimes the process that has locked the table shows up as sleeping in the processlist! I was tearing my hair out until I killed all the sleeping threads that were open in the database in question (none were active at the time). That finally unlocked the table and let the update query run.
@jenlampton Just tried that. I think it's fixed now. I had MySQL kill one of its hung threads.
saving...
still slow...
still... saving...
still...
504 Gateway Time-out

I made https://github.com/backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org/issues/670 for @larsdesigns

b.org server having trouble · Issue #670 · backdrop-ops/backdropcms.org
Today when we went to edit and then save the SA for today's security release, the browser hung for about 60 seconds, then the server threw a SQLSTATE[HY000]: General error: 1205 Lock wait timeo...
I'll just kick the whole server (reboot). :(
ok
I'm now seeing 502 Bad Gateway. Is it still booting?
its back up :)
Still can't save that node. :frown:
saving.... slowly... no dice :( SQLSTATE[HY000]: General error: 1205 Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction
@quicksketch you think anyone is going to be updating sites between now and 8pm?
Some content like releases and notifications still create and save fine. I don't think there will be other content created but we need to get out the SA to go with the release.
I meant updating their own sites, like, will they need the SA before 8pm?
but I guess the answer is yes :)
or maybe I was asking the wrong question.
Trying another thing. Please stand by...
Well I dumped and then emptied/re-imported the whole db. No real difference. MySQL still won't update some tables.
ok let me know when/how I can help
Well I'm pretty close to stumped. Gonna take a break.

Okay, think I got this fixed finally. I don't quite know _why_ but some transaction was refusing to die. I think MySQL was permanently trying to recover some rollback query or something(?) Well the fix was setting innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit = 2 temporarily, that let MySQL flush it's transactions. Now everything seems fine.
@jenlampton You should be able to publish that node now.
hi
Hello, how can I help you?
@larsdesigns you can read the rest of the convo here, and everything we've tried
Nate's last fix seemed promising, but saving the node still throws a 504 Gateway Time-out
oh
I am sniffing around.
Gotta get my pizza. brb
hah! we just had pizza too :)
I am not seeing the my.conf settings that we had previously.
should I try it again?
@larsdesigns I'm going to save the node... are you ready?!?!
/drumroll
@larsdesigns no luck
I'm still seeing 504 Gateway Time-out

I've no idea what you're all talking about, but if I hear that one particular node isn't saving, I wonder what it is about that node that's causing the issue... Is there anything special about the content of this particular node?
@BWPanda (Peter) I can't see anything. It's just text! no special field types or anything
@BWPanda (Peter) I mean, even a straight sql query that only changed the status column on the node table failed
Hmm, well worth a try :blush:
@quicksketch I have an idea. Why don't we turn off php, use a mysql query to update the node status then turn php back on?
@Nate Lampton ^ sorry I keep forgetting your name is not quicksketch here
can I do a service php7.2-fpm stop ?
mysql: unknown variable 'max_connections=100'
uh oh
Found a swap file by the name "/etc/mysql/mariadb.conf.d/.50-server.cnf.swp" owned by: root dated: Thu Mar 26 04:00:36 2020 file name: /etc/mysql/mariadb.conf.d/50-server.cnf
that's funny, @Nate Lampton you only set that to 80 but the system is complaining that its 100
@larsdesigns I su'd to your user and tried to see which file you were editing, but all I can find us mysql.cnf which doesn't exist
I found a duplicate config file at /etc/mysql/conf.d/mysql.cnf

@larsdesigns @Nate Lampton I deleted all the undefined variables from the @larsdesigns mysql.cnf file, and I was able to run mysql from the command line again. So with PHP disabled, I updated the node table.
It didn't work?!? https://backdropcms.org/node/2803
the stauts is 1, but the node shows as unpublished
@jenlampton Sorry I had the 50-server.cnf file open so the .swp file was there. I exited
@jenlampton Maybe the node_revision table needs updating too?
ok, will check
woot! https://backdropcms.org/security/backdrop-sa-core-2020-001-1
that was it :) thanks @quicksketch!
Well, it's published I guess. This seems like a hollow victory.
yeah, but at least we can go to bed tonight :)
@Nate Lampton were you just able to make a test node?
it says 10:37pm!
but it won't delete :/
wishful thinking
sorry, I did not see /etc/mysql/mariadb.conf.d/50-server.cnf
Interesting that I did not get any errors when I reloaded the configuration and the site kept running.
This tells me that the nginx cache likely making this difficult to troubleshoot.
Perhaps we should disable it so we can more accurately see what is happening here.
I have had a super long day and need more sleep. I will check in a little later in the morning.

Thanks for all the work on the security release! FYI the Download button needs updating yet:
Screen-Shot-2020-03-26-at-1.24.28-PM.jpg

tis on the checklist; just hasn't been addressed yet; https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4347 #patienceyoungjedi; ;)

Backdrop 1.15.1 Release checklist · Issue #4347 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Release scheduled for March 25th, 2019 8pm - 9pm PT Pre-release tasks Merge commits @quicksketch Create the next bugfix milestone @jenlampton Move all unfinished issues to the next bugfix release m...
Yeah, backdropcms.org is broken.
We've got our server guy @larsdesigns working on it
in order to publish the SA last night I had to disable PHP, then manually run sql queries to update node and node_revision. then enable php again.
I think we also dropped and re-imported the db a few times, so we likely lost the home page change.
That is so bizarre.

Maybe completely unrelated... but I've had a few sites where certain content just wouldn't save and tracked it down to a ModSecurity rule that kept blocking it. Strangely in this case, creating a blank page works and then pasting the text in and saving works, but creating a new node and pasting the text in directly would not save.
hi
Hello, how can I help you?
Botsnack
:donut: - donuts for everyone!
